verses.roman:
dāmodara-paṇḍita śākhā premete pracaṇḍa
prabhura upare yeṅho kaila vākya-daṇḍa

synonyms: dāmodara-paṇḍita—of the name Dāmodara Paṇḍita; śākhā—another branch (the tenth branch); premete—in affection; pracaṇḍa—very much advanced; prabhura—the Lord; upare—upon; yeṅho—he who; kaila—did; vākya-daṇḍa—chastisement by speaking.
translation: Dāmodara Paṇḍita, the tenth branch of the Caitanya tree, was so elevated in love of Lord Caitanya that he once unhesitatingly chastised the Lord with strong words.
